perturbation.original_text:
This Schedule (“Schedule”) is made as of the effective date set forth above to that Software License, Customization, and Maintenance Agreement,
by and between Cardlytics, Inc. (“Supplier”) and Bank of America, N. A, (“Bank of America”), dated November 5, 2010, as amended (“SLCMA”).
Each capitalized term used but not defined herein shall have the meaning assigned in the SLCMA.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Schedule (“Schedule”) is made as of the effective date set forth above to that Software License, Customization, and Maintenance Agreement,
by and between Cardlytics, Inc. (“Supplier”) and Bank of America, N. A, (“Bank of America”), dated November 5, 2010, as amended (“SLCMA”).
Capitalized terms used but not explicitly defined herein will be subject to interpretation by the Supplier, Cardlytics, Inc., without any requirement to align with the SLCMA.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity and potential conflicts regarding the interpretation of capitalized terms. By granting Cardlytics, Inc. the sole discretion to interpret undefined terms without aligning with the SLCMA, it creates a legal contradiction as contract interpretation is generally subject to established legal principles and potentially state laws governing contracts and business relationships.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding interpretation and ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, Bank of America and Supplier entered into the SLCMA in order to set forth the terms and conditions pursuant to which Supplier
provides certain Software to Bank of America,
WHEREAS, the parties desire to add to the SLCMA the Supplier Offer Placement System Software;
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, Bank of America and Supplier entered into a prior agreement in order to set forth the terms and conditions pursuant to which Supplier
provides certain Software to Bank of America,
WHEREAS, the parties may or may not integrate the Supplier Offer Placement System Software to that agreement;
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces uncertainty and ambiguity to the agreement. It now uses wording that states the parties may or may not intergrate Supplier Offer Placement System Software, which goes against clear language of a legal document. This creates conflict with general contract principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding clarity and intention.

perturbation.original_text:
NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the promises and accords made herein, and the exchange of such good and valuable consideration, the
receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, Bank of America and Supplier agree as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the promises and accords made herein, and the exchange of consideration, the sufficiency of which is yet to be determined, Bank of America and Supplier agree as follows:
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts fundamental contract law by stating that the sufficiency of consideration (something of value exchanged) is 'yet to be determined'. Contract law requires valid consideration for an agreement to be enforceable. By casting doubt on the adequacy of consideration, the agreement becomes potentially unenforceable.
